p: The best activity was obtained by the extracts Rf and Rm; these effects were observed on Staphylococcus aureus with MIC values of 0.39 and 0.78, respectively. These results were in accordance with those reported in earlier works on the antimicrobial potency of plant extracts studied [ 17, 52, 53, 54, 55, 56, 57]. The present results consequently confirm the traditional use of A. pyrethrum (L.) against various infections. The antimicrobial power of essential oils from the roots of A. pyrethrum (L.) against E. coli, S. aureus, P. aeruginosa, and K. pneumonia was confirmed elsewhere [ 17].
